1.heading: Érik (André Jolly), 1912-1974.
1.title: "Allons voir le maître"
1.author: Erik
1.appears_in: back cover of Lisette, no. 10 (Mar. 6, 1955) in Lisette Album, no. 25.
notes: "Résumé: Nique, Pat et la pie Prune, partis dans un soucoupe volante, sont arrivés sur la planète Mars. Le panneau de sortie de la soucoupe s'ouvre."
A robot leads them to its master.
"À suivre."

2.heading: Érik (André Jolly), 1912-1974.
2.title: "C'est vous le martien"
2.author: Erik
2.appears_in: back cover of Lisette, no. 11 (Mar. 13, 1955) in Lisette Album, no. 25.
notes: "Résumé: Nique, Pat et la pie Prune, partis dans une soucoupe volante, sont arrivés sur la planète Mars. Un Martien se présente à eux, les conduit auprès du maître."
"À suivre."

3.heading: Érik (André Jolly), 1912-1974.
3.title: "Il me semble que nous descendons!"
3.author: Erik
3.appears_in: back cover of Lisette, no. 8 (Feb. 20, 1955) in Lisette Album, no. 25.
notes: Summary: "Une soucope volante emporte Pat et Nique. Une voix mystérieuse leur dit de ne rien toucher."
"À suivre."

4.heading: Érik (André Jolly), 1912-1974.
4.title: "Je croyais que les martiens avaient l'exclusivité des soucoupes"
4.author: Erik
4.appears_in: back cover of Lisette, no. 12 (Mar. 20, 1955) in Lisette Album, no. 25.
notes: "Résumé: Nique, Pat et la pie Prune sont partis dans un soucoupe volante. Accueilis par le Grand Maître, celui-ci les déçoit en leur apprenant qu'ils sont toujours sur la Terre."
"À suivre."

5.heading: Érik (André Jolly), 1912-1974.
5.title: "Un Martien!"
5.author: Erik
5.appears_in: back cover of Lisette, no. 1 (Dec. 30, 1954) in Lisette Album, no. 25.
notes: "À suivre."

6.heading: Érik (André Jolly), 1912-1974.
6.title: "Ne touchez à rien s'il vous plaît!"
6.author: Erik
6.appears_in: back cover of Lisette, no. 7 (Feb. 13, 1955) in Lisette Album, no. 25.
notes: "Résumé: Nique et Pat visitent l'intérieur de la soucoupe volante découverte par Pat."
The flying saucer takes off unexpectedly, and a voice addresses them from a wall speaker.

7.heading: Érik (André Jolly), 1912-1974.
7.title: "N'essayez pas de vous échapper, vous êtes mes prisonniers!"
7.author: Erik
7.appears_in: back cover of Lisette, no. 13 (Mar. 27, 1955) in Lisette Album, no. 25.
notes: "Résumé: L'imprudente curiosité de Nique et Pat les conduit chez le Grand Maître, inventeur de soucoupes volantes, qui veut les envoyer sur la planète Mars."
"À suivre."

8.heading: Érik (André Jolly), 1912-1974.
8.title: "Le panneau de sortie est en train de s'ouvrir"
8.author: Erik
8.appears_in: back cover of Lisette, no. 9 (Feb. 27, 1955) in Lisette Album, no. 25.
notes: "Résumé: Nique, Pat et la pie Prune partent dans un soucoupe volante pour la planète Mars."
"À suivre."

9.heading: Érik (André Jolly), 1912-1974.
9.title: "Viens me rejoindre, il n'y a personne!"
9.author: Erik
9.appears_in: back cover of Lisette, no. 5 (Jan. 30, 1955) in Lisette Album, no. 25.
notes: "Résumé: Pat emmène Nique et Prune près de la soucoupe volante qu'il vient de découvrir."
"À suivre."

83.heading: Ernestillo.
83.title: "Carpinteros"
83.author: argumento de Yolanda Vargas Dulché ; dibujos, Sixto Valencia ; textos, Abel Avendaño
notes: SUMMARY: Ernestillo has been falling asleep in school, and is about to be kicked out. His friends are worried, and Ernestillo says his father is sick and somebody has to finish the carpentry jobs. Actually Ernestillo's father has taken to drink and has become abusive and unproductive. The schoolmates witness the drunken father conversing with Ernestillo's dead mother. The boys begin to help with the carpentry each day after school, until one day Ernestillo doesn't appear in class. They get permission to go to Ernestillo's house during school hours, because they are worried.

84.heading: Ernestillo.
84.title: "El Chisme"
84.author: argumento de Yolanda Vargas Dulcé
notes: SUMMARY: Memín, Ricardito and Carlangas find their friend in the carpentry shop, drinking liquor. Ernestillo says that if his father can see his wife and talk to her when he's drunk, he wants to do it too and talk to his mother. When the boys take the bottle from him, Ernestillo attacks with a hammer and manages to knock himself out. His friends put him in his bed, and return to school. The teacher wants to know what they found, and they say Ernestillo wasn't home. The teacher doesn't believe them, and questions them until he gets the truth. The teacher rushes to the carpentry shop, sees Ernestillo unconscious, and calls an ambulance. The boys wait at the hospital while the teacher looks for Mr. Vargas, the missing father of Ernestillo. The news that his son is in the Red Cross hospital shocks Mr. Vargas, and hearing that Ernestillo was trying to see his mother fills him with shame. In the hospital, Ernestillo recovers. The teacher brings Mr. Vargas to his son, and he begs his son's forgiveness.

85.heading: Ernestillo.
85.title: "Riquillo"
85.author: S
notes: SUMMARY: On the first day of public school some of the boys are introduced. Carlos Arozamena (Carlangas) has curly hair and is tough and full of mischief. Ricardo Arcaraz (Ricardito) is a stuck-up rich boy with blonde hair and glasses, the son of a diplomat. Guillermo Manquín (Memín) is the only black boy in the class, and his introduction brings derogatory racial remarks from the other boys. Ernesto Vargas (Ernestillo) is very smart, but poor, and comes to school without shoes. Carlos and Ricardo get into a fistfight. Because of his attitude towards his other classmates, the teacher recommends that Ricardo find another school, and Memín cheers. The teacher gives Memín a lecture about equal opportunity. On the way home from school Memín makes friends with Carlos and Ernesto, and warns Carlos that Ricardo's father is planning to complain about the fight. At home, Memín helps his mother with laundry, and Ernesto helps his father finish some furniture. Carlos goes home, where his mother is sleeping because she works the night shift. Ricardo goes home and hears his mother threaten his classmates when she sees his black eye, but Ricardo says he got it playing a game and doesn't complain. Back at school, Ricardo is excluded from the baseball game, and finally asks to play. Because he wants to take charge of the game, the other boys reject him.

86.heading: Ernestness.
86.title: "Hearing Voices"
86.author: Griffy.
notes: Summary: Zippy's voice described in comparison with the voices of William Bendix, Fred Gwynne, Raymond Burr, John Goodman, and Julia Child.
Key words: Rotundity, wet feedback, dazed innocence, resonant earnestness, precise authority, calm reassurance, puzzling girlishness.
